column2: PENNSYLVANIA PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
3. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column6: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column10: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.

column2: 4. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column2: 6. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column8: It is not recommended to check

column2: 7. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column6: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column8: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column10: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.

column2: 8. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
9. An orange triangle on the back of a vehicle indicates:
column4: that the vehicle has no blind spots.
column8: that the vehicle has the right-of-way.
column10: that the vehicle carries hazardous materials.

column2: 10. The maximum speed limit in this state is ____ MPH.
11. It is against the law for anyone under the age of 21 to ______ alcohol.

13. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
14. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 15. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column10: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.

column2: 16. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: a sharp left turn is ahead.
column10: a law enforcement officer is ahead.

column2: 17. At highway speeds, in normal conditions, a safe following distance is at least _____ from the car ahead of you.
18. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
